Is it correct to say that being a whitening projection is a different condition on the projection matrix than simply being orthogonal?
PCA’s projection matrix orthogonal, and PCA is a whitening projection.
But not all othogonal matrixes are whitening projections, are they?
(both my test and my memory say they are not, but someone is diagreeing with me)

text: PCA diagonalizes the covariance matrix (ie remove correlations) but does not normalize the variances to 1, so I don't think it qualifies at a whitening transformation. On the other hand I'm pretty sure that for any orthogonal matrix you can find some covariance matrix that gets withened by it, but that seems like a strange thing to consider.
